metadata.title: CVE-2022-41322 on Ubuntu 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In Kitty before 0.26.2, insufficient validation in the desktop notificationescape sequence can lead to arbitrary code execution. The user must displayattacker-controlled content in the terminal, then click on a notificationpopup.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41322` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

kitty - 0.21.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
kitty-terminfo - 0.21.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: kitty package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.21.2-1ubuntu0.22.04.1').
